question: Select the correct cross-section from the A-A cross-section in the following figure( )<image 1>
description:
The image shows a technical drawing with a main view and four different cross-sectional views labeled A, B, C, and D. The main view depicts an object with a circular shape and a slot or opening on its surface. The slot has a curved end and a straight section. 

- Cross-section A-A: This view shows a complete circle with no openings or slots.
- Cross-section B-B: This view also shows a complete circle with no openings or slots.
- Cross-section C-C: This view shows a circle with a small slot or opening on one side.
- Cross-section D-D: This view shows a circle with a larger slot or opening that matches the shape seen in the main view.

The correct cross-section that matches the slot shown in the main view is Cross-section D-D.
